dt: {bc}of or relating to the {a_link|gentry} or upper class
{bc}elegant or graceful in manner, appearance, or shape

dt.t: the {wi}genteel{/wi} manners of an old southern gentleman

dt: {bc}maintaining or striving to maintain the appearance of superior or middle-class social status or respectability
{bc}marked by false delicacy, prudery, or affectation

dt.t: was {wi}genteel{/wi} on the surface, but had a hard heart

et: borrowed from French {it}gentil{/it} literally, "of aristocratic birth," going back to Old French {ma}{mat|gentle:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: having an aristocratic quality or flavor : stylish
of or relating to the gentry or upper class
elegant or graceful in manner, appearance, or shape
